definitions.definition: Having teeth of different types (like most mammals ).

Of bivalves or their hinge teeth: having two to three wedge-shaped cardinal teeth set in the centre near the umbones , generally also with elongated lateral teeth on the anterior and posterior margins .
examples: The heterodont arrangement is characteristic of the Venus clams and cockles .

main_definition: ( zootomy ) Having teeth of different types (like most mammals ).
secondary_definitions: ( malacology ) Of bivalves or their hinge teeth: having two to three wedge-shaped cardinal teeth set in the centre near the umbones , generally also with elongated lateral teeth on the anterior and posterior margins .
